rename.from: Extend modules API to allow module report to redis INFO
rename.to: Extend modules API to allow modules report to redis INFO

issue.title: Adds a "Modules" section to `INFO`

repository.name: redis
repository.description: For developers, who are building real-time data-driven applications, Redis is the preferred, fastest, and most feature-rich cache, data structure server, and document and vector query engine.

issue.body:
Fixes #6012.

As long as "INFO is broken", this should be adequate IMO. Once we rework
`INFO`, perhaps into RESP3, this implementation should be revisited.

body:
Concerns:
- It is important for modules to be able to add entries to the INFO output, so that standard monitoring systems would be able to monitor them too.
- Modules should not emit that formatted string directly, so that the API doesn't need to be changed when a future INFO command is changed to include a more semantic format.
- Modules should not be included in the default `INFO` or `INFO all` for fear of causing latency for some systems that just want to get info about replication or memory
- Modules full info should be included in the crash report, but possibly printed after other important information is already emitted to the log, so that a crash in fetching the module info will not leave us completely in the dark.
- All module info fields should be properly prefixed, and not include invalid chars (`:` and '\r\n')
- We want to let each module fill multiple sections if it wishes to.
- In the future we may want INFO command to be able to get a list of requested sections from the user.

API:
```
/* Request to provide info.
 * The module should respond by calling RedisModule_AddInfoSection and
 * RedisModule_AddInfoField* multiple times.
 * The module should avoid calculations that can induce latency.
 */
typedef int (*RedisModuleInfoFunc)(RedisModuleInfoCtx *ctx, int for_crash_report);

/* Used to start a new section, before adding any fields. the section name will 
 * be prefixed by "<modulename>_" and must only include A-Z,a-z,0-9. 
 * When return value is REDISMODULE_ERR, the section should and will be skipped. */
int RedisModule_AddInfoSection(RedisModuleInfoCtx *ctx, RedisModuleString *name);

/* Used by RedisModuleInfoFunc to add info fields.
 * Each field will be automatically prefixed by "<modulename>_".
 * Field names or values must not include \r\n of ":" */
int RedisModule_AddInfoFieldString(RedisModuleInfoCtx *ctx, RedisModuleString *field, RedisModuleString *value);

similarly:
AddInfoFieldCString
AddInfoFieldLongLong
AddInfoFieldULongLong
AddInfoFieldDouble

int RedisModule_RegisterInfoFunc(RedisModuleCtx *ctx, RedisModuleInfoFunc cb);
```

Behavior:
- `INFO` - the default info will not include any info about modules.
- `INFO all` - will only include the list of loaded modules and versions (#6024)
- `INFO modules` - will include the list of loaded modules, as well as all the sections modules want to add (calling RedisModuleInfoFunc with argc=0)
- `INFO everything` - same as `INFO all` and `INFO modules`
- `INFO <module_name> - will emit all the sections of a specific module
- `info <section>` - if the specific section requested was not found in redis section list, RedisModuleInfoFunc will be called for all the modules (hoping that one will fill it)

Questions:
- do we want to provide a user_data argument to the callback?
- do we want to support dict fields (like the ones in INFO KEYSPACE)?
- how do we format double fields?
@antirez @gkorland @MeirShpilraien @mnunberg please respond so that i can implement this.
One possible improvement is that `AddInfoSection` does the section filtering, returning an error if the section should be skipped, so that RedisModuleInfoFunc doesn't need to take argv and argc.
The `<section>` part seems a bit weird to me. I'm thinking that maybe `INFO modules <module> ... whatever args` might be more familiar
@mnunberg IMO, no - it will break bw compat

you can't give args.. only section name (maybe in the future multiple ones)
maybe `INFO <module_name>` will automatically emit all sections of that specific module?
so you can `INFO modules` (all modules), or `INFO mymodule` (one module), or `info mymodule_section` (one section).

issue.title: Extend modules API to allow modules report to redis INFO

body: @antirez i'm don't think #6024 closes this issue... #6024 just adds module name and version, not information that the module determines

> @antirez i'm don't think #6024 closes this issue... #6024 just adds module name and version, not information that the module determines

Sure, there is another one that really adds the ability of modules to add new INFO sections, it was submitted by @oranagra.
